resources.string: Carrier data accounting may differ from your device.
Day of month to reset data usage cycle:
No apps used data during this period.
Enable usage of mobile data in the background
To restrict background data for this app, first set a mobile data limit.

This feature may cause an app that depends on background data to stop working when only mobile networks are available.\n\nYou can find more appropriate data usage controls in the settings available within the app.
Restricting background data is possible only when you\u2019ve set a mobile data limit.

Any changes you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your phone.\n\nSome accounts may also automatically copy any changes you make on the phone to the web. A Google Account works this way.
This will conserve data and battery usage, but you\u2019ll need to sync each account manually to collect recent information. And you won\u2019t receive notifications when updates occur.

Your phone will turn off mobile data once it reaches the limit you set.\n\nSince data usage is measured by your phone, and your carrier may account for usage differently, consider setting a conservative limit.
If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won\u2019t work unless you\u2019re connected to Wi\u2011Fi.
If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won\u2019t work unless you\u2019re connected to Wi\u2011Fi.\n\nThis setting affects all users on this phone.
%2$s: about %1$s used, as measured by your phone. Your carrier\u2019s data usage accounting may differ.
Metered networks are treated like mobile networks when background data is restricted. Apps may warn before using these networks for large downloads.
To select metered networks, turn Wi\u2011Fi on.
Carrier data accounting may differ from your device.
Tap here to sign in to network
Set up & manage wireless access points
5 GHz band not available in this country
Notify when a high\u2011quality public network is available
Wi\u2011Fi will turn back on near high\u2011quality saved networks, like your home network
Unavailable because location is turned off. Turn on location.
Unavailable because Wi\u2011Fi scanning is turned off
To use, select a network rating provider
Don\u2019t use a Wi\u2011Fi network unless it has a good internet connection
Only use networks that have a good internet connection
Automatically connect to high\u2011quality public networks
To use, select a network rating provider
To use, select a compatible network rating provider

To improve location accuracy, apps and services can still scan for Wi\u2011Fi networks at any time, even when Wi\u2011Fi is off. This can be used, for example, to improve location-based features and services. You can change this in LINK_BEGINscanning settingsLINK_END.
To improve location accuracy, turn on Wi-Fi scanning in LINK_BEGINscanning settingsLINK_END.
There was a problem changing the setting
Minimize battery usage when Wi\u2011Fi is on
Switch to mobile data if Wi\u2011Fi loses internet access.
Use mobile data when Wi\u2011Fi has no internet access. Data usage charges may apply.
Wi\u2011Fi doesn\u0027t turn back on automatically
To see available networks, turn Wi\u2011Fi on.
You don\u2019t have permission to change the Wi\u2011Fi network.
To turn on Wi\u2011Fi automatically, you first need to turn on Wi\u2011Fi scanning.

Wi\u2011Fi scanning allows apps and services to scan for Wi\u2011Fi networks at any time, even when Wi\u2011Fi is off. This can be used, for example, to improve location\u2011based features and services.
Drop down list Advanced Options. Double-tap to collapse.
Drop down list Advanced Options. Double-tap to expand.

If your router is not broadcasting a network ID but you would like to connect to it in the future, you can set the network as hidden.

This may create a security risk because your phone will regularly broadcast its signal to find the network.

Setting the network as hidden will not change your router settings.
Choose at least one band for Wi\u2011Fi hotspot:
No certificate specified. Your connection will not be private.
To improve location accuracy and for other purposes, %1$s wants to turn on network scanning, even when Wi-Fi is off.\n\nAllow this for all apps that want to scan?
To turn this off, go to Advanced in the overflow menu.
%1$s requires you to sign in online before you connect to the network.
This network has no internet access. Stay connected?
Don\u2019t ask again for this network
Wi\u2011Fi is not connected to the internet
You can switch to the mobile network whenever Wi\u2011Fi has a bad connection. Data usage charges may apply.
All passwords for this network will be deleted
Wi\u2011Fi advanced settings are not available for this user
Type a network prefix length between 0 and 32.
If you disconnect, your connection with %1$s will end.
If you disconnect, your connection with %1$s and %2$s other devices will end.
Do you want to cancel invitation to connect with %1$s?
Not sharing internet or content with other devices
Sharing this phone\u2019s internet connection via hotspot
App is sharing content. To share internet connection, turn hotspot off, then on
Use hotspot to create a Wi\u2011Fi network for your other devices. Hotspot provides internet using your mobile data connection. Additional mobile data charges may apply.
Apps can create a hotspot to share content with nearby devices.
Wi\u2011Fi hotspot will turn off if no devices are connected
Unavailable because airplane mode is turned on
Turn on Wi\u2011Fi calling to extend coverage

When Wi-Fi calling is on, your phone can route calls via Wi-Fi networks or your carrier\u2019s network, depending on your preference and which signal is stronger. Before turning on this feature, check with your carrier regarding fees and other details.
Used as your location when you make an emergency call over Wi\u2011Fi
Learn more about Private DNS features
Wi\u2011Fi calling is not supported for %1$s
Not connected due to low quality network
Automatically connected via network rating provider
Show options for wireless display certification
Increase Wi\u2011Fi logging level, show per SSID RSSI in Wi\u2011Fi Picker
Randomize MAC address when connecting to Wi\u2011Fi networks
Select Logger sizes per log buffer
When we no longer are monitoring with the persistent logger, we are required to erase the logger data resident on your device.
Store logger data persistently on device
Select log buffers to store persistently on device
Always keep mobile data active, even when Wi\u2011Fi is active (for fast network switching).
Use tethering hardware acceleration if available
USB debugging is intended for development purposes only. Use it to copy data between your computer and your device, install apps on your device without notification, and read log data.
Revoke access to USB debugging from all computers you\u2019ve previously authorized?
These settings are intended for development use only. They can cause your device and the applications on it to break or misbehave.
Check apps installed via ADB/ADT for harmful behavior.
Bluetooth devices without names (MAC addresses only) will be displayed
Disables the Bluetooth absolute volume feature in case of volume issues with remote devices such as unacceptably loud volume or lack of control.
Enable terminal app that offers local shell access
Debugged application waits for debugger to attach before executing
Flash screen when apps do long operations on main thread
Screen overlay showing current touch data
Flash entire window surfaces when they update
Flash views inside windows when drawn with the GPU
Flash hardware layers green when they update
Always use GPU for screen compositing
Disable automatic routing to USB audio peripherals
Force screen layout direction to RTL for all locales
Force use of GPU for 2d drawing
Enable 4x MSAA in OpenGL ES 2.0 apps
Allow loading GPU debug layers for debug apps
Destroy every activity as soon as the user leaves it
Display App Not Responding dialog for background apps
Displays on-screen warning when an app posts a notification without a valid channel
Makes any app eligible to be written to external storage, regardless of manifest values
Make all activities resizable for multi-window, regardless of manifest values.
Enable support for experimental freeform windows.
Desktop full backups aren\u2019t currently protected
Tap to change or remove the password for desktop full backups
New password and confirmation don\u2019t match

Note: After a reboot, this app can\'t start until you unlock your phone
You won\'t hear your next alarm %1$s unless you turn this off before then

The hostname you typed isn\u2019t valid.
The exclusion list you typed isn\u2019t properly formatted. Type a comma-separated list of excluded domains.
You need to complete the port field.
The port field must be empty if the host field is empty.
The port you typed isn\u2019t valid.
